intro: Porterandia sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flower porterandia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
